intro: Aletris fragrans, commonly known as sweet grass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its aromatic properties have made it popular in traditional herbal medicine and as a decorative plant. Aletris fragrans is also valued for its ability to thrive in woodland gardens with minimal care.
